project_description: A simple Flutter application that displays a text of a Cat (with a clock icon) and when the text is clicked, it changes to Dog (with a person icon).
architecture_overview: The project uses the Cubit pattern for state management, ensuring a clear separation of concerns between the UI and the business logic. The application is highly modularized with one class per file, organized into distinct folders for screens, cubits, models, and widgets.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
participant HomeScreen
participant TextDisplayWidget
participant TextCubit
User -> HomeScreen: Launch App
HomeScreen -> TextDisplayWidget: Display Initial Text
TextDisplayWidget -> TextCubit: Initial State
TextCubit -> TextDisplayWidget: Cat with Clock Icon
User -> TextDisplayWidget: Click Text
TextDisplayWidget -> TextCubit: Toggle Text
TextCubit -> TextDisplayWidget: Dog with Person Icon
@enduml
state_management_flow: The state is managed using the Cubit pattern. The TextCubit manages the state of the text and icon. When the user clicks on the text, the toggleText method of the TextCubit is called, which toggles the text and updates the icon. The updated state is then emitted and the TextDisplayWidget rebuilds with the new state.
navigation_flow: The application has a single screen (HomeScreen) which displays the TextDisplayWidget that toggles between 'Cat' and 'Dog' when clicked.
